narrative.title: 4Th Indian Division - 1940Q2
narrative.situation: British infantry_division deployed in North Africa during 1940Q2.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division for desert operations in Egypt and Sudan. Training and organization phase during 1940-Q2, not yet in active combat operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Desert and coastal plain (Fayed/Ismailia training area, Egypt-Libya border)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: First Indian division deployed overseas in WWII
Experienced in desert conditions and training
Mixed British and Indian battalions per brigade

environment.terrain_type: Desert and coastal plain (Fayed/Ismailia training area, Egypt-Libya border)
